nodes.name: Science
nodes.description: Science is a systematic process that builds and organizes knowledge in the form of testable explanations and predictions about the universe.

nodes.name: Physics
nodes.description: The study of matter and energy and the interactions between them.

nodes.name: Chemistry
nodes.description: The study of the composition, properties, and behavior of substances.

nodes.name: Biology
nodes.description: The study of living organisms, including their structure, function, growth, evolution, and distribution.

nodes.name: Geology
nodes.description: The study of the Earth's solid materials, including rocks, minerals, and the processes that shape the Earth's surface.

nodes.name: Astronomy
nodes.description: The study of celestial objects and phenomena that originate outside the Earth's atmosphere.

nodes.name: Environmental Science
nodes.description: The study of the environment and how living organisms interact with it.

nodes.name: Mathematics
nodes.description: The study of numbers, quantities, shapes, and patterns.

nodes.name: Computer Science
nodes.description: The study of computation and computer systems.

nodes.name: Statistics
nodes.description: The study of the collection, analysis, interpretation, presentation, and organization of data.

nodes.name: Psychology
nodes.description: The scientific study of the mind and behavior.

nodes.name: Sociology
nodes.description: The study of society, its structure, functions, and development.

nodes.name: Anthropology
nodes.description: The study of humans, past and present, and their societies.

nodes.name: Political Science
nodes.description: The study of government, political behavior, systems, and policies.

nodes.name: Economics
nodes.description: The study of the production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.

nodes.name: History
nodes.description: The study of past events, particularly human affairs.

nodes.name: Philosophy
nodes.description: The study of fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, values, reason, and more.

nodes.name: Linguistics
nodes.description: The scientific study of language and its structure.

nodes.name: Literature
nodes.description: The study of written works, such as novels, poems, plays, and essays.

nodes.name: Art
nodes.description: The study and creation of visual, auditory, or performing works that express human emotions and ideas.

nodes.name: Music
nodes.description: The study and enjoyment of sounds organized in time.
